div.p: Welcome back from Spring Break! Due to COVID-19, Distance Learning will continue for the rest of the school year.
Thank you for supporting Measure X! During the COVID-19 crisis, construction at all sites is paused. We will continue as soon as it is safe to do so.

a.aria-label: Read more about Measure X Information

div.p: Welcome!

a.aria-label: Read more about San Mateo-Foster City School District

div.p: The San Mateo-Foster City School District educates, inspires and empowers every student in every school every day to live, lead and learn with integrity and joy.
The SMFCSD offers a combination of assigned schools and magnet schools.

a.aria-label: Read more about FAQs - School Choice

div.p: See the current SMFCSD board agenda

a.aria-label: Read more about our board agendas

div.h2: Q: How do I register my children for school?
div.p: A: Please visit the How to Register page for information about school registration.
div.h2: Q: What Is my School of Assignment?
div.p: A: Use the SchoolFinder to find out. You can also look at the district map.
div.h2: Q: What are SMFCSD's Magnet Schools/Programs?
div.p: A: The SMFCSD has many specialized programs. Visit the Magnet Schools page.
div.h2: Q: How old must a child be to enter Kindergarten or Transitional Kindergarten (TK)?
div.p: A: To be eligible for Kindergarten, the student’s 5th birthday must be on or before September 1. To be eligible for TK, the student’s 5th birthday must fall on or between September 2 – December 2. Attend a SMFCSD Kindergarten Information Meeting in October to find out more about what to expect - Enrollment & Student Registration.

The San Mateo-Foster City School District does not allow discrimination, intimidation, harassment (including sexual harassment) or bullying based on a person’s actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, nationality/national origin, immigration status, ethnic group identification/ethnicity, age, religion, marital status/ pregnancy/ parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, medical information or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.

h2.span: APRIL 7, 2020: Our schools will stay closed for the rest of the school year

p.span: the county superintendents in six Bay Area counties, including San Mateo, announced the extension of campus closures through the end of the school year. This decision was made in collaboration with the public health officers in the counties and our County Superintendent, Nancy Magee. As a result, we will continue to deliver Distance Learning to our students through June, 2020. Please read this message (in English and Spanish) from Dr. Joan Rosas, Superintendent, to all staff and families. You can also review this press release (English | Spanish) from Superintendent Magee.

In her April 7 letter to staff and families, Dr. Rosas shared an update on the District's four construction projects. In an abundance of caution and to maintain general public safety, all four projects have been paused by decision of the SMFCSD Board of Trustees. Dr. Rosas thanked our general contractors, their subcontractors and our SMFCSD Facilities Team adding, "
The buildings have already taken shape and we will be up and running again as soon as it is deemed safe to do so."

h2.span: april 3, 2020: spring break Message from Dr. rosas, superintendent

p.span: Please read today's Spring Break message (English | Spanish) from Dr. Joan Rosas, Superintendent. It includes details of Distance Learning Phase II which will begin after Spring Break, Frequently Asked Questions about Distance Learning and other topics, Spring Break resources for families, and Health, Wellness, Housing and other resources.

Please NOTE: When we return from Spring Break, Monday and Tuesday, April 20 and 21 will be dedicated to professional development and instructional planning. Distance Learning will resume on Wednesday, April 22.

section.h2: want to see all coronavirus (covid-19) announcements?
section.p: Please go to our Coronavirus Updates and Resources page!
section.h2: sign up to receive the Our Newsletter
section.p: The SMFCSD Newsletter is a publication of the San Mateo-Foster City School District covering events and sharing important information about the school district and its students. We look forward to keeping you up-to-date!

img.alt: SMFC Ed Foundation Logo

div.p: The San Mateo Foster City Education Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit volunteer organization founded in 1989. The mission of the Foundation is to support and enhance public education in the 20 elementary and middle schools in San Mateo and Foster City. The Board of Directors is comprised of business professionals, educators, parents and community members. There are currently five ex-oficio members and an Advisory Board of community leaders to guide and assist the Board.
Visit the San Mateo Foster City Education Foundation website for more information.

div.p: The LCAP provides important new ways for parents to engage in decision making. Plans describe the school district’s overall vision for students, annual goals and specific actions the district will take to achieve the vision and goals.
